```lean4
import Mathlib

open Filter Topology Metric

/--
Let $f$ be a real function with a continuous third derivative such that $f(x), f'(x), f''(x), f'''(x)$ are positive for all $x$.  Suppose that $f'''(x)\leq f(x)$ for all $x$.  Show that $f'(x)<2f(x)$ for all $x$.
-/
theorem putnam_1999_b4
(f : ℝ → ℝ)
(hf : ContDiff ℝ 3 f)
(hpos: ∀ n ≤ 3, ∀ x : ℝ, iteratedDeriv n f x > 0)
(hle : ∀ x : ℝ, iteratedDeriv 3 f x ≤ f x)
: ∀ x : ℝ, deriv f x < 2 * (f x) :=
sorry

```lean4
theorem putnam_1999_b4
(f : ℝ → ℝ)
(hf : ContDiff ℝ 3 f)
(hpos: ∀ n ≤ 3, ∀ x : ℝ, iteratedDeriv n f x > 0)
(hle : ∀ x : ℝ, iteratedDeriv 3 f x ≤ f x)
: ∀ x : ℝ, deriv f x < 2 * (f x) :=
by
  intro x
  have h₁ := hpos 0 (by norm_num) x
  have h₂ := hpos 1 (by norm_num) x
  have h₃ := hpos 2 (by norm_num) x
  have h₄ := hpos 3 (by norm_num) x
  have h₅ := hle x
  have h₆ := hpos 0 (by norm_num) x
  have h₇ := hpos 1 (by norm_num) x
  have h₈ := hpos 2 (by norm_num) x
  have h₉ := hpos 3 (by norm_num) x
  -- Normalize the inequalities to prepare for the proof
  norm_num at *
  nlinarith [h₁, h₂, h₃, h₄, h₅, h₆, h₇, h₈, h₉,
    iteratedDeriv_succ f 0 x, iteratedDeriv_succ f 1 x, iteratedDeriv_succ f 2 x, iteratedDeriv_succ f 3 x]
```

theorem putnam_1999_b4
(f : ℝ → ℝ)
(hf : ContDiff ℝ 3 f)
(hpos: ∀ n ≤ 3, ∀ x : ℝ, iteratedDeriv n f x > 0)
(hle : ∀ x : ℝ, iteratedDeriv 3 f x ≤ f x)
: ∀ x : ℝ, deriv f x < 2 * (f x) := by
  intro x
  have h₁ := hpos 0 (by norm_num) x
  have h₂ := hpos 1 (by norm_num) x
  have h₃ := hpos 2 (by norm_num) x
  have h₄ := hpos 3 (by norm_num) x
  have h₅ := hle x
  have h₆ := hpos 0 (by norm_num) x
  have h₇ := hpos 1 (by norm_num) x
  have h₈ := hpos 2 (by norm_num) x

    iteratedDeriv_succ (f := fun x => f x) 0,

    iteratedDeriv_succ (f := fun x => f x) 2]
